title: Input schema for TikTok scraper
description: Scrapes the hashtag searches, profiles and individual posts.

hashtags.title: Hashtag(s) to scrape from TikTok
hashtags.description: Just add TikTok hashtags and the scraper will collect information about users, followers, likes, and more.

resultsPerPage.title: Max results
resultsPerPage.description: The number of results that will be scraped from every hashtag and profile.

profiles.title: Profile(s)
profiles.description: Add the name of user you want to scrape.
profiles.sectionCaption: Use profile(s) or start URL(s) instead of hashtags

postURLs.title: Direct URL(s) for scraping specific video(s)
postURLs.description: Add the URLs of posted videos you want to scrape. You can enter URLs one by one, or you can upload or link to a text file.

commentsPerPost.title: Max comments per post
commentsPerPost.description: The number of comments that will be scraped from every scraped result. 0 means no comments will be scraped and you don't need to use cookies to login
commentsPerPost.sectionDescription: TikTok limits access to comments if a user is anonymous. If you want to scrape comments, you have to provide cookies to log in as a normal TikTok user (you can copy with a Chrome plugin like 'EditThisCookie'). Note that we recommend that you ** do not use your own TikTok account for this ** - use a new, temporary TikTok account. When cookies are used, the run is limited to concurrency 1 and one session, so that the account does not get banned too soon.

loginCookies.title: Cookies
loginCookies.description: If you want to scrape comments you need to sign in to TikTok and you can use your cookies on input.

proxyConfiguration.title: Set up your proxy configuration
proxyConfiguration.description: Automatic proxy and the country of your choice is usually the best option, but you can also select specific proxies, or use your own custom proxies.

maxRequestRetries.title: Max request retries
maxRequestRetries.description: How many times a page will be retried in case of being blocked or other errors.

maxConcurrency.title: Max Concurrency
maxConcurrency.description: Max number of allowed instances running in parallel. More instances need more memory!
